00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implement vector and matrix element extraction.
00004 #
00005 package Parser::BOP::underscore;
00006 use strict;
00007 our @ISA = qw(Parser::BOP);
00008 
00009 #
00010 #  Check that the operand types are OK
00011 #
00012 sub _check {
00013   my $self = shift;
00014   return if ($self->checkStrings());
00015   my ($ltype,$rtype) = $self->promotePoints();
00016   if ($ltype->{name} =~ m/Vector|Matrix|List/) {
00017     if ($rtype->{name} =~ m/Number|Vector/ ||
00018     ($rtype->{name} eq 'List' && $rtype->{entryType}{name} eq 'Number')) {
00019       $self->{type} = {%{$ltype}};
00020       $self->{type}{length} = $rtype->{length};
00021     } elsif ($self->context->flag("allowBadOperands")) {$self->{type} = $Value::Type{number}}
00022     else {$self->Error("Right-hand operand of '_' must be a Number or List of numbers")}
00023   } elsif ($self->context->flag("allowBadOperands")) {$self->{type} = $Value::Type{number}}
00024   else {$self->Error("Entries can be extracted only from Vectors, Matrices, or Lists")}
00025 }
00026 
00027 #
00028 #  Perform the extraction.
00029 #
00030 sub _eval {
00031   my $self = shift; my $M = shift; my $i = shift;
00032   $i = $i->data if Value::isValue($i);
00033   $i = [$i] unless ref($i) eq 'ARRAY';
00034   my $n = $M->extract(@{$i});
00035   return $n if ref($n);
00036   return $self->Package("List")->new($self->context) if $n eq '';
00037   return $n;
00038 }
00039 
00040 #
00041 #  If the right-hand side is constant and the left is a list
00042 #    extact the given coordinate(s).  Return empty lists
00043 #    if we run past the end of the coordinates.  Return
00044 #    a simpler extraction if a portion of the extraction
00045 #    can be performed.
00046 #
00047 sub _reduce {
00048   my $self = shift; my $equation = $self->{equation};
00049   my $context = $self->context;
00050   my $reduce = $context->{reduction};
00051   return $self unless $self->{rop}->{isConstant} && $self->{lop}{coords} && $reduce->{'V_n'};
00052   my $index = $self->{rop}->eval; my $M = $self->{lop};
00053   $index = $index->data if Value::isValue($index);
00054   $index = [$index] unless ref($index) eq 'ARRAY';
00055   my @index = @{$index};
00056   while (scalar(@index) > 0) {
00057     unless ($M->{coords}) {
00058       return $self->Item("Value")->new($equation,$self->Package("List")->new($context))
00059         unless $M->type =~ m/Point|Vector|Matrix|List/;
00060       return $self->Item("BOP")->new($equation,$self->{bop},
00061           $M,$self->Item("Value")->new($equation,@index))
00062     }
00063     my $i = shift(@index); $i-- if $i > 0;
00064     $self->Error("Can't extract element number '%s' (index must be an integer)",$i)
00065       unless $i =~ m/^-?\d+$/;
00066     $M = $M->{coords}[$i];
00067     return $self->Item("Value")->new($equation,$self->Package("List")->new($context)) unless $M;
00068   }
00069   return $M;
00070 }
00071 
00072 $Parser::reduce->{'V_n'} = 1;
00073 
00074 #
00075 #  Brace the index for TeX.  (Not really good for multiple indices.)
00076 #
00077 sub TeX {
00078   my ($self,$precedence,$showparens,$position,$outerRight) = @_;
00079   my $TeX; my $bop = $self->{def};
00080   $position = '' unless defined($position);
00081   $showparens = '' unless defined($showparens);
00082   my $addparens =
00083       defined($precedence) &&
00084       ($showparens eq 'all' || $precedence > $bop->{precedence} ||
00085       ($precedence == $bop->{precedence} &&
00086         ($bop->{associativity} eq 'right' || $showparens eq 'same')));
00087   $outerRight = !$addparens && ($outerRight || $position eq 'right');
00088 
00089   my $symbol = (defined($bop->{TeX}) ? $bop->{TeX} : $bop->{string});
00090   $TeX = $self->{lop}->TeX($bop->{precedence},$bop->{leftparens},'left',$outerRight).
00091     $symbol.'{'.$self->{rop}->TeX.'}';
00092 
00093   $TeX = '\left('.$TeX.'\right)' if $addparens;
00094   return $TeX;
00095 }
00096 
00097 #
00098 #  Perl used extract method of the Value::List object.
00099 #
00100 sub perl {
00101   my ($self,$precedence,$showparens,$position) = @_;
00102   my $bop = $self->{def};
00103   $self->{lop}->perl($bop->{precedence},$bop->{leftparens},'left').
00104     '->extract('.$self->{rop}->perl.')';
00105 }
